## Definition

[Global Supply Chains]{.hp} are production networks that assemble products using parts from around the world (known as intermediate goods)

::: {.fragment}
This has resulted in the presence of [intermediate inputs]{.hp} increasing within trade, relative to the final good flows

Today, [80 percent of world trade]{.hp} is driven by supply chains run by multinational corporations
:::

::: {.fragment}
Trade in [intermediate goods]{.hp} is now nearly [twice as large]{.hp} as trade in [final goods]{.h} and is specially important in advanced manufacturing industries
:::
